intro: Millettia impressa subsp. goetzeana, commonly known as the Goetze's millettia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf venation and floral structure compared to other members of the species.
